Description: You have a job so vocational rehabilitation service center will pay for the vehicle modifications so that you can drive.
Your insurance changed its policy and can now upgrade you to a new wheelchair that is easier to transport.
Today has nice driving conditions.
You hit all of the green lights which allows you to arrive at your destination 5 minutes faster.
Your vehicle was upgraded to be more accessible.
Outcome: Move up 2 spaces and receive $5 in savings

Description: Your family member can drive you so that you can take a rest in the passenger seat.
Your friend keeps you company, which you enjoy.
Your insurance now covers a secondary form of transportation allowing you to have different vehicles.
Your vehicle now has an autopilot mode which allows you to drive with less effort.
Outcome: Receive $5 in savings and move 2 spaces

Description: You just got a new wheelchair which is lighter than the last one, making loading it into your car much easier.
Outcome: Move up 1 space and receive $5 in savings

Description: Your gas station has an attendant who is nice and helps you fuel your car easily.
The driver helps buckle your wheelchair into the accessible seating area making sure you are safe before continuing the drive.
The driver is knowledgeable about your disability and offers assistance.
Someone on the bus moves from the accessible seating area to another area on the bus, allowing you to use that space.
The driver calls out all the incoming stops for you to give you time to prepare to depart from the bus.
You see another person with disabilities in the accessible seating area and they provide you with some helpful advice.
The bus company has a rating system for bus drivers which prompts bus drivers to be nicer and more understanding in general.
Outcome: Receive $5 in savings and move up 1 space

Description: The payment system on all public transit is down (free rides)!
The bus company has upgraded all public transport with real time tracking, which prevents you from missing a bus or light rail that comes early.
Your wheelchair was upgraded with your new insurance plan to make it easier to use the bus.
The bus is on time today!
The bus company has upgraded all public transport with USB charging ports.
The bus company offers discounted bus fare to disabled people regardless of type or age.
The bus company installed larger bus shelters that can accommodate you and your wheelchair.
The paratransit is on time today!
The driver picks you up last and drops you off first.
Paratransit offers an app with real time tracking.
You are the only one on the paratransit and the driver drops you off earlier than expected.
You can use paratransit service for half price!
The driver is your favorite and shows up on time for pick up.
The driver is very experienced and gets you to your destination in record time.
The driver is your favorite and provides assistance when needed.
The paratransit vehicle was upgraded with new doors, ramps, seats, and wheelchair tie downs which help everyone get on and off the paratransit faster.
Your wheelchair was upgraded with your new insurance plan to make using paratransit more comfortable.
Paratransit is now covered by the city, and you can ride for free twice a day.
You find a $5 bill on the Walk!
The city has installed accessible water fountains. You're able to have a drink, which gives you a second wind of energy.
It is a gorgeous sunny day with a light breeze.
The city has implemented a new safer streets initiative that prioritizes pedestrians.
The city has improved all of its Walks making it easier for you to move around with your wheelchair.
The city has installed crosswalks with flashing lights to alert drivers that a pedestrian is crossing the road.
The city has implemented a program to fix the Walk cracks and level the Walks.
A stranger offers to help push your mobile device up a hill and save your arms/wheelchair battery.
Outcome: Receive $5 in savings and move up 4 spaces

Description: Walks are modified to be wider which accommodates you and a friend to walk beside you.
Outcome: Receive $5 in savings and move up 2 spaces

Description: Slower walkers ahead of you move aside so that you can pass by easily.
Your wheelchair was upgraded with your new insurance plan.
Your friend offers to drive so that you can rest.
Your family member can give you a free ride!
Your insurance now covers a secondary form of transportation allowing you to have different wheelchairs.
A street vendor is giving out food samples which gives you energy to keep going.
You found an app that provides you with the most accessible route to your destination.
